intro: Haplosphaera, commonly known as the common liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the order Marchantiales. It is characterized by its thalloid structure, which is a flat, leaf-like body that lacks true roots, stems, or leaves. Haplosphaera typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or rocky areas, and thrives in humid climates. The plant reproduces via spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia. Its simple morphology and ability to tolerate various environmental conditions make it an important pioneer species in ecological succession.
